Class GameState

java.lang.Object
com.calcgame.main.GameState
public class GameState extends Object
Represents the state of the game at all times. Starts the game when constructed.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    GameState.RenderType
    Represents the type of rendering used (in console (not yet implemented) or windowed)

  • Field Details

    • random

      protected Random random
      The object used to generate random numbers, and the initial random seed

    • random_sequence

      protected List<Integer> random_sequence
      A list of all random numbers in the order they were generated, used for undoing operations involving randomness

    • cur_random_i

      protected int cur_random_i
      The index in random_sequence of the last random number generated by the selected action

    • button_types

      protected Map<String,CalcButton> button_types
      All registered types of buttons. The key is the type id, value is a CalcButton that was initialised without arguments, and as such can only be used to create other buttons.

    • mod_files

      protected Map<String,Map<String,String>> mod_files
      All loaded mod files, where the first key is the mod id, the second key is the file name

    • all_buttons

      protected List<CalcButton> all_buttons
      All registered buttons.

    • button_lookup

      protected Map<String,CalcButton> button_lookup
      A map, where the key is the button id, and the value is the CalcButton object representing the button

    • sellable_buttons

      protected List<CalcButton> sellable_buttons
      A list of all buttons that can appear in the shop

    • buttons

      protected ButtonCollection buttons
      A collection of all buttons currently on the calculator, including system buttons (e.g. '=')

    • reroll_button

      protected ShopRerollButton reroll_button
      The shop reroll button

    • next_round_button

      protected NextRoundButton next_round_button
      The next round button, that appears below the shop

    • undo_button

      protected UndoButton undo_button
      The undo button

    • redo_button

      protected RedoButton redo_button
      The redo button

    • goal

      protected org.python.core.PyComplex goal
      The number that the player has to reach to end the current round. Is set to a random number in the range of [0, 100) at start of round.

    • shop_slots

      protected int shop_slots
      The amount of slots for normal buttons in the shop

    • infinity_shop_slots

      protected int infinity_shop_slots
      The amount of slots for infinity buttons in the shop

    • screen

      protected String screen
      The text currently displayed on the calculator screen, does not have to be a valid formula

    • money

      protected org.python.core.PyComplex money
      The amount of money the player currently has

    • inShop

      protected boolean inShop
      If the shop is currently visible

    • shop

      protected ButtonCollection shop
      The collection of all buttons in the shop, may be null if inShop is false

    • current_round

      protected long current_round
      The number of the current round

    • renderType

      protected GameState.RenderType renderType
      The type of rendering currently used (windowed, console, etc.)

    • window

      protected Frame window
      The window in which everything is rendered

    • overlay

      protected Panel overlay
      A panel, which has bounds the same as the window. Anything in this panel will be rendered above anything not in this panel.

    • calc_screen

      protected Label calc_screen
      The label that is rendered at the top of the calculator

    • goal_label

      protected Label goal_label
      The label, where the current goal is rendered

    • money_label

      protected Label money_label
      The label, where the current money is rendered

    • tooltip_labels

      protected List<Label> tooltip_labels
      A list of all labels, of which the tooltip consists. Usually has a constant size of 64

    • tooltip_bg

      protected Panel tooltip_bg
      The panel that provides the tooltip background

    • undo_stack

      protected List<Action> undo_stack
      The undo stack, consists of all actions done using doAction(Action)
      See Also:
      • undo()
      • redo()

    • temp_action

      protected Action temp_action
      The action to be appended to the next action done using doAction(Action)
      See Also:
      • appendToNextAction(Action)

    • cur_undo_stack_i

      protected int cur_undo_stack_i
      The index of the action currently selected in the undo_stack

    • events

      protected Map<String,Event> events
      A map, where the keys are event ids, and the values are the event objects.
      See Also:
      • Events

    • seed

      protected long seed
      The random seed, generated when this object is constructed.

  • Method Details

    • addSystemButtons

      public void addSystemButtons()
      Adds vital buttons to the game (e.g. '=', 'UNDO', 'REDO', 'Reroll', etc.)

    • prepareRender

      public void prepareRender()
      Prepares the window for rendering, creating all necessary frame and label objects

    • loadMods

      public void loadMods()
      Loads all mods from the mod folder (./mods), and starting buttons from them

    • loadConfig

      public void loadConfig(File file, String mod_id)
      Loads all mod configuration, except starting buttons, from a file
      Parameters:
      file - the file to load from
      mod_id - the id of the mod that supplied the file

    • loadStartingButtons

      public void loadStartingButtons(File file, String mod_id)
      Loads the starting buttons from a mod config file
      Parameters:
      file - the file to load from
      mod_id - the mod id of the mod that supplied this file

    • refreshShop

      public void refreshShop()
      Refreshes the shop, or creates it if it didn't exist. Appends the (undoable) refresh action to the last action (being) executed.

    • nextRound

      public void nextRound()
      Starts the next round, closing the shop and increasing the round counter. Generates one action, that is not undoable

    • endRound

      public void endRound()
      Ends the current round, and displays the shop. Generates one action, that is not undoable.

      Parameters:

    • randint

      public int randint(int min, int max)
      Returns a random number between min (inclusive) and max (exclusive)
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum number (inclusive)
      max - the maximum number (exclusive)
      Returns:
      a random number in the range [min, max)

    • onRoundStart

      public void onRoundStart(String id, org.python.core.PyObject f)
      Registers a Python function to be executed at start of round.
      Parameters:
      id - The id to register the function under. It's only effect is to be used in removeOnRoundStart(String) later.
      f - The Python function to register. Must be a callable python object.

    • removeOnRoundStart

      public void removeOnRoundStart(String id)
      Removes the function that was previously registered using onRoundStart(String, PyObject)
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the function to remove

    • chance

      public boolean chance(int a, int b)
      Has a a/b chance to return true. Uses randint(int, int)
      Parameters:
      a - the quantifier
      b - the divisor
      Returns:
      true with a chance of a/b, false otherwise

    • setTooltip

      public void setTooltip(String text, Rectangle bounds)
      Renders a tooltip with the specified contents at the specified position
      Parameters:
      text - The contents of the tooltip to render. Will be line-wrapped to fit into the specified bounds.
      bounds - the position and size of the tooltip to render

    • removeTooltip

      public void removeTooltip()
      Removes any tooltip currently rendered

    • undo

      public void undo()
      Invokes Action.undoInternal() of the action currently selected in the undo stack, and moves the selection to the previous action.

    • redo

      public void redo()
      Moves the selection to the next action in the undo stack, and invokes Action.redo() of the newly selected action.

    • doAction

      public void doAction(Action action)
      Appends the specified action to the undo stack (at the position after the currently selected action), then executes it. Also appends a reset of this GameState random state (to it's state before the action is executed) to the undo function
      Parameters:
      action - the action to execute and save to the undo stack

    • appendToLastAction

      public Action appendToLastAction(Action action)
      Appends the specified Action to the last action executed (or currently being executed) by the means of Action.andThen(Action). It will not be executed, unless it is undone and then redone. The returned action is safe to Action.redo() without invoking doAction(Action)
      Parameters:
      action - the Action to append
      Returns:
      the input action

    • appendToNextAction

      public void appendToNextAction(Action action)
      When doAction(Action) is invoked next time, the specified Action will be appended to the doAction parameter (by the means of Action.andThen(Action)), before it is executed.
      Parameters:
      action - the Action to append

    • getCurrentActionContext

      public ActionContext getCurrentActionContext()
      Returns the context of the last executed Action
      Returns:
      the context of the last executed Action

    • getEvent

      public Event getEvent(String name)
      Returns the event with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the event
      Returns:
      the event, or null if it does not exist
      See Also:
      • Events
